intro: Fimbristylis exilis, commonly known as slender threadgrass, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowering heads. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and swamps. Its flowers are usually pale green to brown and are borne on very short, stiff stalks. Fimbristylis exilis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Australia and Southeast Asia.
